body.name: YI 2K Dome Security Camera, 2.4G Smart Indoor Pet Monitoring Cam with Night Vision, 2-Way Audio, Motion Detection, Phone APP, Compatible with Alexa and Google Assistant
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 16 hrs 39 mins
features: 2K HD VIDEO & IMAGE QUALITY: View every event in 2K image quality so that you can clearly see what is happening inside your home. Upgraded 3 million pixels, up to 2304 x 1296 resolution, for clarity in every angle.

SMART AI DETECTION & REAL-TIME ALERTS: the indoor security camera accurately distinguishes person, vehicle, animal, and abnormal sounds which reduces false alarms significantly and sends you real-time motion-triggered alerts (subscription needed).

FOLLOW THE ACTION & TALK IN REAL-TIME: When motion is detected the camera automatically tracks and follows the moving object. With the built-in microphone and speaker, you can also hear the sound from the scene and speak with people on the camera side.
ENHANCED NIGHT VISION: Equips with 850-nm infrared lights, a high-sensitivity image sensor and F1.9 large aperture lens, YI 2K home camera captures detailed images even in low-light conditions.

SECURED DUAL STORAGE (LOCAL SD CARD & CLOUD STORAGE): Store your data and recordings locally with an extra microSD card (not included) or in the cloud. YI Cloud offers loop-recording with no storage limit, so even if your camera is stolen or damaged, your footage will still be secure and accessible on the cloud. reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good bang for buck
reviews.reviewText: This is a good bang for your buck. Not a great bang for your buck. I’ve used Yi for 3 years now. The monthly service( although not necessary - I used free service for over a year) is affordable and fairly reliable/ however it seems every time I want to go back and view something important ( my child’s first steps) somehow the system “glitched”. I contact customer service, of course there’s nothing they can do. I have a stranger in my front and backyard with a weapon visible / but I can’t see anything but a blurry blob for his face in every single frame. Police department can do nothing with the images other than roll their eyes. I click live view to see if my babies are sleeping in their cribs soundly, well I can’t even see the babies in their cribs much less tell if they’re breathing or not. I suppose on 1080 being able to see chest rise and fall is too large an expectation, I don’t know. Most other times the cameras are fine for MINOR, LIGHT, BRIEF surveillance. Please consider something on a much higher level if you need to really micromanage a business for theft, or have any security issues at home or business, You will be disappointed. If you’re using these just for light surveillance at home / of your entrances , main common areas, tool or equipment storage or to watch your animals, you’ll most likely be pleased. The cameras last forever. They are easy to set up and maintain. The free service is fine, we only upgraded because we have 6 or so cameras and I like live view of multiple cameras at all times plus recorded cloud and SD memory. It’s worth the 9.99 monthly charge IF AND WHEN it happens to capture the images or videos I’m searching for. It glitches out and takes a while to view often, but as stated I’m not protecting a multimillion dollar museum of art, I use them for home security- in a safe secure area with more shotguns, rifles and rednecks than any other area of the US and I believe the cameras are just fine for that. If I lived in a high crime area I would consider another camera/service but for what we need they’re pretty ok. They mount easily. The motion detection is good. They run on 110 plug- so if power or WiFi is down, so are they, and we must hide cords in two rooms that we have them mounted on ceilings. You must purchase SIM card for cameras to function properly. You can share live feed or video via text or social media and can share camera view by allowing access and giving login to other family members/business partners through the YI account. You will be able to see if anyone has logged in or viewed your account. It offers additional password protection for uncommon areas such as bedrooms. That’s a nice feature. Over all good product. Yes I would purchase again. I’ve purchased several over the past few years and bought my in laws a system for their residence out of state. If another company were to offer a better product and better quality viewing for a comparable or even a bit higher price, I would change over in a heartbeat. So there’s my honest review. Hope it is helpful.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Seriously, Buy It
reviews.reviewText: I wanted a cheap camera to watch my dog. I didn't want a camera that was going to try to charge me a subscription for every little feature. I checked reviews and this kept being recommended. The reviews were right! Decent quality picture, night vision, controls, motion detection with notifications, hear audio, ability to speak to your animal, can be accessed by mutiple people, take pictures, security pin, and live feed. All without a subscription. It takes videos when it detects motion but those do require a subscription to access. Controls have almost no lag and it goes side to side and up and down. Couldn't be happier and am thinking about buying at least one more. Also was super easy to setup and works with Google Home and Assistant.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent hardware. Software could be improved.
reviews.reviewText: The hardware is excellent. The camera has been panning and tilting for over a year and now, and no issues at all. The software, however, could use work. It is a bit rough around the edges. The orientation of the app is all sorts of messed up if you use it on an iPhone or an iPad and put the Picture in full screen. The subscriptions for premium services are also quite pricey; I’m fine with that only if the software is more put together well. When looking at clips from the cloud, there is often a very bad lag.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I got this to keep an eye on my dogs when we are not home. I love the fact it tracks them around the room and I can talk to them over the speaker on the camera or listen in when they are barking. Easy to set up, download the app and you’re good to go. It has a nice clear picture even at night.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars I used to love these, not anymore
reviews.reviewText: Before Kami bought out Yi, these were THE BEST cameras. I had them for years and years with no issues. I recommended them to TONS of people and some got them, too. Their Customer Service was friendly, helpful and quick. Then Kami bought them out.Ever since it’s been nothing but connectivity issues, lag, delay, firmware updates that don’t happen, etc etc.But because I already had others, I decided to get two more, assuming newer tech would mean less problems. At least that’s what their response emails to my issues said… Not so much.These are useless. You cannot control them from the PC app, only from the mobile app. And despite it saying EVERYWHERE on their website that it takes SD up to 128, it doesn’t. It caps out at 64. Doesn’t say that anywhere. So now I have 2 128SDs I can’t use and a camera that won’t record.New Customer Service takes days to get back to you (if they do at all), they are rude, only give canned responses that don’t fit your question, and then tell you to just buy their monthly service instead.Can’t help but feel that this is a bait n switch to force you to use their cloud storage service.Never again willl I buy them, never again will I recommend them. Save your money and your sanity and buy literally anything else.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love the easy of setup and how well they work! They have reduced my stress level of caring for my aging mother dramatically

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewText: If you plan on using a SD card forget about these cameras. They make it unbearable to use without their subscription service. The camera's are cheap is the only upside.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I’ve been using Yl products for years. The app works great for multiple cameras. Clear picture, great smart detection features and price point is perfect

reviews.reviewTitle: Frustrating Ads when you open the App !
reviews.reviewText: Thru the years, we have bought a dozen of these cameras… watching pets, then kids, and then elderly parents front/back doors.We started with a couple of cameras and liked the App. So, bought more.They do break down after a few years, but still a good deal given the low price. We just replace them with new Yi cameras.Initially, there were no Ads when you open the App. Then there were Ads every time I open the App about Yi’s cloud service and Kami service program. It was annoying, but I can quickly close the box and view my camera.But in the past year, in addition to their own Ads, they have added Ads from outside companies that you can’t just easily close quickly. The Ads stay on for several seconds before it allows you to close, and you’re forced to search the the Ad page looking for the close box. The close box is in a different spot every time and not always in English, so, you don’t know which is the close box. And many times, I’ve been tricked and tapped on the wrong spot and got re directed to the Ads website… wasting another several seconds. Then after I have to start over and go back to the Yi App.Before I can quickly look on Yi App and see who’s there at the door. Now, with navigating the Ads, by the time I get to the camera stream, the person is long gone.So, the cameras are useless for me now. Maybe if you’re willing to pay monthly for their expensive cloud service, it’ll be Ad free?We are so disappointed with Yi. Now with the Yi cameras slowly breaking down one by one, instead of getting more Yi cameras, we have switched to another brand …. So much better not to deal with those Ads everytime I open the App!!!When I looked online, I found that many people have the same problems with these Ads. Just google the discussion forum on yi technologies… there are a lot of complaints about these Ads that have been added.Save yourself the frustration and Stay away from this brand !!!! There are better options out there for the same or lower price!

reviews.reviewTitle: 360° Surveillance & Night Vision: YI Pan-Tilt Security Camera - Total Peace of Mind for Your Home
reviews.reviewText: The YI Pan-Tilt Security Camera is a versatile indoor surveillance camera that provides peace of mind by keeping a watchful eye on your space. With its 360-degree pan-tilt functionality, 2.4G connectivity, and night vision capabilities, this camera offers a range of features that cater to the needs of pet owners and security-conscious individuals alike.The standout feature of this security camera is its 360-degree pan-tilt capability, which allows you to remotely control the camera's movement and view a complete area. This functionality is especially useful for keeping an eye on mischievous pets or monitoring larger spaces where a fixed camera would fall short. The smooth and precise motorized movement ensures you can scan your surroundings effortlessly.Equipped with 2.4G Wi-Fi connectivity, the YI Pan-Tilt Security Camera provides a stable and reliable connection to your home network. This allows you to access the camera's live feed and recorded footage remotely via the YI Home App, providing convenience and peace of mind even when you're away from home.The camera's night vision capabilities ensure round-the-clock surveillance. With infrared lights and advanced image processing, the camera can capture clear and detailed footage in low-light or complete darkness. This makes it an ideal solution for monitoring your space during nighttime hours or ensuring the safety of your pets even in dimly lit environments.Setting up the YI Pan-Tilt Security Camera is a breeze, thanks to its user-friendly installation process and intuitive app interface. The YI Home App provides a seamless user experience, allowing you to customize settings, set motion detection alerts, and even communicate through the camera's built-in two-way audio feature.Additionally, the camera supports motion detection, sending instant notifications to your smartphone when any movement is detected in its field of view. This feature proves invaluable for keeping tabs on your pets' activities or for enhancing the security of your home.While the YI Pan-Tilt Security Camera offers an impressive array of features, it's important to note that some advanced functionalities, such as cloud storage or integration with third-party smart home systems, may require a subscription or additional devices.In summary, the YI Pan-Tilt Security Camera is a feature-rich indoor surveillance solution that offers peace of mind and versatile monitoring capabilities. With its 360-degree pan-tilt functionality, 2.4G connectivity, night vision, and motion detection features, it caters to the needs of pet owners and security-conscious individuals. The user-friendly setup and intuitive app interface further enhance its usability. Despite the potential need for additional subscriptions for advanced features, the YI Pan-Tilt Security Camera remains a reliable choice for keeping your space under constant surveillance.

Good thing I happen to have a 2G network for an older printer, otherwise this wasn’t going to work at all.Picture quality is choppy even on HD (possibly because it’s on the 2G network). Microphone picks up voices but can’t make out what they’re saying. Turn night vision off if it’s in a window with a screen (it just reflects the screen) otherwise it works pretty well. A light on nearby helps in both situations.Make sure you buy a micro SD card! It holds a lot of video/data so it can run a long time (days) and not fill up.Overall 3 stars because it’s really neat lol. Has a lot of settings you can tinker with. The night vision and the intercom features are cool.

reviews.reviewTitle: There is a hidden cost with this camera
reviews.reviewText: UPDATE: I'm updating my original review because I managed to figure out how to record on the SD card. It's not obvious and requires you to format the SD card but at least it's not required to subscribe to the Yi cloud to view the SD card recordings. So I updated this review to 4 stars. Overall, the camera works well and as advertised. The reason I'm not giving 5 stars is even though I can now view videos on the SD Card, I still get the "subscribe to the Yi cloud" pop-up every single time I use the app. And I do mean every time. Besides this annoyance, everything else works as advertised.Old review: This camera would not be bad if they didn't force you to subscribe to their cloud service to be able to see the videos that are recorded on the SD card inside the camera. So the minimum additional cost for you will be ~$40 per year if you want to see videos which are recorded on the SD card you have to buy with this product. Seriously Yi?
